title: 400 Years Later, Spain May Have Found 'Don Quixote' Author's Grave
teaser: Archaeologists in Madrid may have discovered the long-lost remains of Miguel de Cervantes. NPR's Scott Simon asks whether or not the bones are his, and if they'll attract tourists to the site.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
